page.title: 01Introduction to Pontypridd
page.content:
Pontypridd is a small market town in Mid-Glamorgan,South Wales.It lies 12 miles north of Cardiff and near the Rhondda valleys.It is famous as the birthplace of Evan James and James James,father and son composers of the Welsh National Anthem in 1856,called Hen Wlad Fy Nhadau.They were born in Mill St and there are statues of them in the lovely Ynysangharad Park.The famous one-span bridge was built by William Edwards in 1750.There is a rugby ground at Sardis Rd,the most famous player was Tommy David.Near the town is Treforest Industrial Estate. Some of the people born in Pontypridd are Sir Geraint Evans,Stuart Burrows, Tom Jones,singers;Merlin Rees,once the Home Secretary;Russell Robins,Tommy David,rugby players.
By Ceri James of Graig-y-wion school
